comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Peter, I thought that Haughey handled that very well at the time, he is quite deadpan here but he spoke and acted very magnanimously.  It really is one of those that all us snappers would love to have taken!

comment.author: 55597723@N02
comment._content: Nice Photo ( back then ) Glad she won. Most likely a good President of a great Land.

comment.author: 54160790@N07
comment._content: As a twelve year old girl, at the time, I was so happy she won. The hard-hearted grumpy old cynic that I am now would say "but what difference does it make - it's only a ceremonial role." At the time though she seemed so vibrant and optimistic compared to all the old grey men in grey suits. It was definitely the first time I took any interest in politics. So thanks NLI, for putting me in touch with my inner idealist if only for a moment. And thanks Mrs Robinson.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/54160790@N07] Yes, if this hadn't been a November shot, I could have called it "Here's to you, Mrs Robinson"!  :)  And you should always bring your inner idealist out for a walk every now and then...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
